titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Goldstone Papers
titlestmt.author: by Monika Lehman

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:01

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers document Richard Goldstone's process of writing Thornton Wilder's biography, Thornton Wilder: An Intimate Portrait . The collection includes photocopied and original correspondence between Goldstone and Wilder, Goldstone's research notes on Wilder's career and family life, and book reviews and correspondence in response to Goldstone's biography. The collection also contains correspondence between Wilder and friends and family, as well as Goldstone's correspondence with Isabel Wilder and others associated wtih Wilder during the course of his writing the biography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers document Richard Goldstone's process of writing Thornton Wilder's biography, Thornton Wilder: An Intimate Portrait which was published in 1975. The collection includes photocopied and original correspondence between Goldstone and Wilder, Goldstone's research notes on Wilder's career and family life, and book reviews and correspondence in response to Goldstone's biography. The collection also contains correspondence between Wilder and friends and family, as well as Goldstone's correspondence with Isabel Wilder and others associated wtih Wilder during the course of his writing the biography.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Richard Goldstone Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Goldstone Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Henry Goldstone, professor of English at the College of the City of New York. Goldstone published a biography of Thornton Wilder entitled Thornton Wilder: An Intimate Portrait (New York: Saturday Review Press) in 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: 1976 Acquisition and 1991 Acquisition.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Richard Goldstone in 1976 and 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 1976 Acquisition includes Goldstone's research on Wilder, correspondence, clippings, and programs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The notecards and other groupings of materials are arranged in the order in which they were recieved by the library. The correspondence is arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notecards Goldstone used in the course of his research on Thornton Wilder's life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clipping retrieved from notecard box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thornton Wilder's records from Berkeley High School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and notes on criticism of The Skin of Our Teeth.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Harris and Thornton Wilder, clippings, and notes.

did.unittitle: Notes on Thornton Wilder in Chicago

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also notes on Thornton Wilder's relationship with Robert Maynard Hutchins.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brochures, catalogs, correspondence and notes pertaining to the Lawrenceville School where Thornton Wilder was a faculty member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, "Thornton Wilder in Oberlin- A Few Memories", and "Two Teachers"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings, letter from Goldstone to the editor at the New York Times, and a program from the London production of Our Town

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an article entitled "Professor Armstrong's 'Experiment'" written by Edward Gatewood Trueblood includes reflections of Thornton Wilder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes brochures from the Thacher, correspondence with one of Thornton Wilder's classmates, and an excerpt of Wilder's entrance evaluation.

did.unittitle: The Skin of Our Teeth chapter drafts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article on Wilder's appearance in Xerxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopied typescript from Maude Hutchins describing an encounter with Thornton Wilder and F. Scott Fitzgerald.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typed and handwritten letters to and from Richard Goldstone, Isabel Wilder, and Thornton Wilder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Isabel, Thornton, and publishers. Also includes one letter from Thacher to Amos Niven Wilder discussing Goldstone's interview with Thacher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder also includes correspondence between Isabel, Thornton, and the Harper and Row publishers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript and copies of correspondence with Thornton Wilder. Also clippings relating to Thornton Wilder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings and photocopied clippings relating to Thornton Wilder and his relationship with Lady Colefax.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, and notes surrounding a New York Times article focusing on the relationship between Thornton Wilder and Sibyl Colefax.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter to the editor and review of Goldstone's biography in The New Haven Register

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters written to and from Thornton Wilder to correspondents. Most of the letters are photocopies of either handwritten or typescript letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a typescript letter written by Wilder to Mrs. Barnes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of letters exchanged between Thornton Wilder and Isabel Wilder and Miriam and Richard Beer-Hofman-Lens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Isabel Wilder and Richard Goldstone, Carol Brandy and John Macrae related to Goldstone's biography of Wilder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of Wilder's handwritten letter to Richard Goldstone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of Wilder's correspondence with Greene mailed to Isabel Wilder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of Wilder's handwritten letters to Helen M. Hosmer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a handwritten letter from Wilder to Mrs. Howe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of Wilder's handwritten letters to Otto Latte Klemperer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of handwritten letter by Wilder to Stone.

did.unittitle: Isabel and Thornton Wilder: letters to readers (photocopies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of typescript and handwritten letters answering questions from readers.

did.unittitle: Isabel and Thornton Wilder: general correspondence (photocopies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of correspondence between Thornton Wilder and Miriam Beer-Hofman- Lens, Wilder and Michael Reinhardt, and Isabel Wilder and Michael Myerberg

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in chronological order as it was recieved by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 1991 Acquisition consists of typed transcripts created by Goldstone of letters from Wilder.

did.unittitle: Letters addressed to Richard Goldstone from Thornton Wilder
Typed transcripts from Wilder to Goldstone (7 folders)
